content: <metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Geospatial Technology Section, Idaho Department of Water Resources</origin><pubdate>20090101</pubdate><title>CLU_08_ESPA_031912</title><geoform>vector digital data</geoform><pubinfo><pubplace>Boise, ID</pubplace><publish>Idaho Department of Water Resources</publish></pubinfo><onlink>http://www.idwr.idaho.gov/GeographicInfo/</onlink><onlink>http:/idwr.idaho.gov</onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>Land within the county classified as "irrigated", "non-irrigated", or "semi-irrigated." The classification is based on edited CLU (Common Land Unit) polygons from the Farm Services Administration. "Semi-irrigated" is generally residential land.</abstract><purpose>This data set was generated to use in the calculation of recharge and evapotranspiration in order to calibrate the Eastern Snake Plain Aquifer Hydrologic Model.</purpose><supplinf>The key attribute is "IRR_STATUS." The interpretation and classification process is described in detail in the report, "2006 Irrigated Land Classification for the Eastern Snake Plain Aquifer" (http://www.idwr.idaho.gov/News/WaterCalls/Surface%20Coalition%20Call/background/irrigated-nonirrigated%20by%20county/2006%20irrigated-nonirrigated%20classification%20report.pdf)</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20091124</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>2006</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>As needed</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-115.311656</westbc><eastbc>-110.95249</eastbc><northbc>44.879291</northbc><southbc>41.957893</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>EPA GIS Keyword Thesaurus</themekt><themekey>Environment</themekey><themekey>Ground Water</themekey><themekey>Regulatory</themekey><themekey>Monitoring</themekey><themekey>Human</themekey><themekey>Water</themekey></theme><theme><themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt><themekey>environment</themekey></theme><place><placekt>None</placekt><placekey>Idaho</placekey><placekey>Snake River Plain</placekey><placekey>Snake Plain Aquifer</placekey></place><place><placekt>None</placekt><placekey>Idaho</placekey></place></keywords><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>None.</useconst><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntorgp><cntorg>Idaho Department of Water Resources</cntorg><cntper>Margie Wilkins</cntper></cntorgp><cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype><address>322 East Front Street</address><city>Boise</city><state>ID</state><postal>83720</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>(208) 287-4800</cntvoice><cntfax>(208) 287-6700</cntfax><cntemail>gisinfo@idwr.idaho.gov</cntemail><cntinst>http://www.idwr.idaho.gov/GeographicInfo/</cntinst></cntinfo></ptcontac><datacred>Idaho Department of Water Resources | GIS Section Boise, Idaho</datacred><native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.5.4400</native></idinfo><dataqual><attracc><attraccr>Classifications based on irrigation status are bound to have errors. No ground verification was made.</attraccr></attracc><logic>This dataset MAY NOT have topological integrity. The original linework digitizing edits were completed in a File Geodatabase format by county. Unfortunately, it was discovered too late that conversion from FGDB to shapefile (for attribute editing) segments true arcs. There was no recovery option. The arcs in this dataset (pivots, curves, etc) may be segmented, i.e. made up of short line segments rather than true arcs and curves. Classifications based on irrigation status are bound to have errors. No ground verification was made. This dataset may have overlapping polygons (minimal) and gaps.</logic><lineage><procstep><procdesc>The creation of this dataset was a two-year effort. Original linework is from the Farm Service Agency's (FSA) Common Land Unit (CLU) dataset of or around 2006. FSA no longer distributes this data to the public. Project time constraints required acceptance of "less-than-perfectly-accurate" linework. In other words, line work that was deemed "close enough" to ground truth of 2006 NAIP imagery was accepted. Attribute assignments (irrigated, non-irrigated, and semi-irrigated) were determined using the 2006 NAIP and available 2006 Landsat imagery as background reference. The 2006 NAIP imagery is 2-meter resolution and is available for agriculture areas only. Landsat imagery is typically 30-meter (l5) or 15-meter (l7) resolution. This dataset extends beyond the Eastern Snake Plain Aquifer Model boundary (ESPAM2). Line and attribute correctness is more accurate within ESPAM2 boundary.</procdesc></procstep><procstep><procdesc>Dataset updated to correct irrigation status on a few polygons.</procdesc><procdate>20100120</procdate></procstep></lineage></dataqual><spdoinfo><direct>Vector</direct><ptvctinf><sdtsterm><sdtstype>Complete chain</sdtstype><ptvctcnt>244584</ptvctcnt></sdtsterm></ptvctinf></spdoinfo><eainfo><detailed><enttyp><enttypl>CLU_08_ESPA_031912</enttypl><enttypd>Internal Feature Number</enttypd></enttyp><attr><attrlabl>Shape_Length</attrlabl><attrdef>Length of feature in internal units.</attrdef><attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom>Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>Shape_Area</attrlabl><attrdef>Area of feature in internal units squared.</attrdef><attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom>Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>Shape</attrlabl><attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef><attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>STATUS_2008</attrlabl></attr><attr><attrlabl>ACRES</attrlabl><attrdef>area in acres - must be updated manually</attrdef><attrdefs>IDWR</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl><attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef><attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv></attr></detailed></eainfo><metainfo><metd>20120829</metd><metc><cntinfo><cntorgp><cntorg>IDWR</cntorg><cntper>Margie Wilkins</cntper></cntorgp><cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing</addrtype><address>322 East Front Street</address><city>Boise</city><state>ID</state><postal>83720-0098</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>208-287-4800</cntvoice><cntemail>margie.wilkins@idwr.idaho.gov</cntemail></cntinfo></metc><metstdn>FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn><metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv><mettc>local time</mettc></metainfo></metadata>
